intro: Jacquinia berteroi subsp. portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican Jacquinia, is a rare shrub native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils within montane forests and cloud forests. It is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest in botanical conservation efforts.
